intro: Scabiosa stellata proles simplex, commonly known as the starflower or sweet William, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, spherical seed heads that are attractive to birds and insects. Native to Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, textured appearance.
